result.execSummary:
The defendant Konstantinos D Tsigistras was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

The Court grants expungement of this case conditional on Mr. Tsigistras successfully completing the Probation term and being discharged from Probation. 

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Konstantinos D Tsigistras

records.addlTxt: with criminal case settlement and elements forms

case called at 2:22pm. [MK]
Defendant Konstantinos D Tsigistras in court with Attorney Robert J. Penegor.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; ; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Tsigistras guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

On Count # 1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Tsigistras on Probation for one year, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 surcharge, plus $100 in drug testing fees 


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
The Court grants expungement of this case conditional on Mr. Tsigistras successfully completing the Probation term and being discharged from Probation. 
recess 2:40pm.
